ÊArt. 4.231. 
Injury 
A partition made by an ascendant may be contested on the ground of injury of more than one quarter, without prejudice to the possibility of applying for a reduction in accordance with Articles 4.150 to 4.157.
A child who, for one of the reasons set out in the first paragraph, challenges the partition made by the ascendant, must advance the costs of the valuation. He shall ultimately bear them, as well as the costs of the dispute, if the claim is unfounded.
